intro: Crepinella japurensis, commonly known as the Japurá crepeflower, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has palmate leaves with a velvety texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
